trans-unit.source: So how do leveled reader levels fit in decodable reader stages? The two concepts are complementary, and Bloom allows you to set both a decodable stage and a leveled reader level for a book you are writing. Typically books at level 1 and possibly level 2 will also need to be written with decodability stages in mind. Books at the first level or two will also need to be careful about being decodable (i.e. using letters the reader has learned). So a sequence of books might look like this:
